segments.text: I see the water overflowing, and it’s making me feel so neutral.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are being sneaky, but it’s not really my concern.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the boy is going to fall, but that’s just how things go sometimes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting for a cookie, and it’s all very ordinary.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is so focused on that plate, and it’s just another day in the kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can watch this without feeling much of anything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring out, and it’s not really affecting me.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think this is just another moment in life.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is just very neutral to me.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the boy doesn’t get hurt, but I’m not too worried about it.
segments.speaker: PAR
